text: Andrey Dmitriyevich Dementyev (; July 16, 1928 in Tver – June 26, 2018 in Moscow) was a Russian and Soviet poet, a laureate of Lenin’s Young Communist League Award (1981), a USSR State Prize (1985), and Bunin Prize (2007). In October 1993, he signed the Letter of Forty-Two. Dementyev died on June 16, 2018 in Moscow from prostate cancer, aged 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Andrey Dementyev, Peoples.ru * Online Encyclopedia 'Krugosvet' * Andrey Dementyev poetry at Stihipoeta.ru Category:1928 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Russia Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Russian poets Category:Soviet writers
title: Andrey Dementyev
